CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1958 reads: "NAACP Life Membership - The National Alliance of Postal Employees (NAPE), through its president, Frederick D. Lee (third from left), presented a down payment recently on a $500 life membership to Louis L. Mason, NAACP membership campaign chairman (right). Present at the ceremony, also, were, left to right, first row: John G. Jones, NAACP treasurer; Perry Ward, financial secretary of NAPE, and (back row) Wayland Bryant and James E. Johnson, NAPE welfare chairman and treasurer, respectively. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: John G. Jones, Perry Ward, Frederick D. Lee presenting NAACP membership check to Louis L. Mason on behalf of the National Alliance of Postal Employees, with Wayland Bryant and James E. Johnson in back row, gathered in Wesley Center AME Zion Church
